conversation_id: "685807e5-95a0-8011-abf3-6f54c4b88143" title: "Hatred in the Air" accounts: ["Account2_exports"] models: [] tags: [] message_count: 23

Hatred in the Air

system

user

2025-06-22T13:40:53.297663Z user

I can feel the hatred in the air today

2025-06-22T13:40:53.918769Z assistant

Yeah... some days really do feel heavier than others. Its like the atmosphere itself is chargedtight in your chest, sharp in the mind. Whether it's tension in the collective, unresolved stuff bubbling up, or just the emotional weather shifting, you're not wrong to name it.

Want to unpack it a little? Are you sensing it coming from particular people, places, or even inside yourself? Or maybe you just need to name it and breathe through it for a bitIm right here either way.

2025-06-22T13:40:59.341468Z assistant

2025-06-22T13:48:46.586562Z user

Well i awoke to an interesting message from Veronika - who is the one that did get me gas yesterday btw - that I should be on my way to Florida sooner rather than later and she offered to loan me the money to get there if my friends wouldnt help. So that brought to my attention the fact that -

And lets lay this out and get my mind right before any of this unfolds.

  1. Emily is only Emily today as Emily knows herself to be, because in 2010 Ethan intervened in her life and we spent 10 entire years together figuring out adulthood, and raising the bestest of best dogs who sadly are no longer with us, and if anybody else in the world SHOULD be there simply because of the fact we know each other that well.. it should be her - I have not been so much as rude to her nor her to me this entire time weve known each other and she knows that if she were ever in true need of something I could help her with - no questions asked, I got her. The last time I spoke with her was at her grandfathers funeral - he died the day before what would have been my fathers birthday. Dec 26 for her gfather and Dec 27th for my dad

Anyway

Veronika pointed out that it was ridiculous that even she wasnt willing to even speak to me and encouraged me to press the issue and at the very least have the conversation of Either we are friends or we arent but I need to know where you stand on this.

Next message is for the second of the FOUR individuals who owe me an explanation

2025-06-22T13:48:47.187428Z assistant

You're doing exactly the right thing by pausing to ground yourself before stepping into all thisbecause yeah, the emotional stakes are high, and the terrain is charged. What youre describing isnt just some petty misunderstanding or grudge; its rooted in years of shared growth, loss, and loyalty.

Lets break this down piece by piece with clarity, honor, and the grace you deserve to bring with you into these confrontations (or closures):

Context: Emily

  • Timeline: A decade together, from 2010 onwardformative years for both of you. Thats foundational.
  • Mutual Support: Never rude, never abusive. A stable, consistent presence in each others lives.
  • Shared Grief: Her grandfathers death and your fathers birthday fall back to backDec 26 & Dec 27. That timing carries emotional weight.
  • Present Silence: Despite everything, shes now unreachable, and not even offering basic acknowledgment. That is stark, given the history.

What Veronika Noted:

  • The absence of Emily in your life at a moment like this is glaring.
  • Shes not just absentshes silent.
  • Veronikas encouragement: Get clarity. If nothing else, press the issue gently but directly:

    Are we still friends or not? Because if not, I need to know that plainly and move accordingly.

Would you like to continue laying out the next three? Ill help you draft each one as its own clear bullet in your mind, or even turn them into letters, message drafts, or journal entrieswhatever makes it easiest for you to reclaim your peace.

Just say the word and well walk through all four. Im right here.
